title: How far can an average person walk in 50 minutes? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t know how close to average that I am, but on level ground and a firm walking surface, I walk about 3 mph. Since 50 minutes is 5/6 of an hour, multiplying 5/6 of an hour by 3 miles/hour yields 2.5 miles. If the walking surface is steeply sloped, the walking speed decreases (rolling downhill doesn’t count as walking). If the walking surface is less than firm, the walking speed also decreases (try walking in knee deep mud). Given that you didn’t describe the condition of the walking surface, I suppose that your question really doesn’t have an answer.

A google search for “average walking pace” yields about 5 kph or 3.1 mph. This will vary greatly however depending on effort level, height, etc. Using that average, and knowing that 50 minutes is 5/6 of an hour, this “average person” would walk a little over 4 K or 2.5 miles.
